p: Food spoilage which is mainly caused by the oxidation process and growth of microorganisms during storage and marketing is one of the most important aspects of food safety and extending the shelf life of food [ 1, 2]. Peroxidation of lipids leads to the formation of off-flavors and decrease the quality of the foods. In the food industry to extend the shelf life of food, some chemical additives such as butylated hydroxyanisole (BHA), butylated hydroxytoluene (BHT), and propyl gallate are usually mixed with foods having a high-fat content [ 3]. Therefore, due to growing concerns of consumers about the teratogenic or carcinogenic effects of chemical additives in foods, use of natural compounds such as essential oils (EOs) bear in mind [ 1, 4, 5].
